thread.title: Winter Weather Advisory Issued As Snow Closes In On Region
thread.title_full: Winter Weather Advisory Issued As Snow Closes In On Region

author: CBS Pittsburgh
title: Winter Weather Advisory Issued As Snow Closes In On Region
text:
Winter Weather Advisory Issued As Snow Closes In On Region March 9, 2017 10:54 AM Filed Under: National Weather Service , Snow , Winter Weather Advisory 
PITTSBURGH (KDKA) – Winter weather is expected to return this evening, which has prompted some alerts to be issued. 
According to the National Weather Service, a Winter Weather Advisory is in effect for Allegheny County beginning at 10 p.m. tonight through 9 a.m. Friday. 
The NWS says 2-4 inches of snow could fall in the Pittsburgh area during that time. 
A Winter Weather Advisory has been issued for the following counties from 6 p.m. tonight through 7 a.m. Friday: 
Armstrong, Butler, Clarion, Forest, Indiana, Jefferson, Lawrence, Mercer and Venango Winter weather advisory for overnight hours along I-80. Minor changes to forecast map from yesterday. #upwithKDKA #kdkaWx pic.twitter.com/TYu8QLsEpz 
— Ron Smiley (@RonSmileyWx) March 9, 2017 
A total of 3 to 5 inches in expected with the heaviest snowfall happening overnight. 
Due to the timing of the snow, the morning commute could be impacted. 
Stay With KDKA.com For More Details
